name: encroachment
content:
encroachment noun
(TAKING FROM SOMEONE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] the act of gradually taking away someone else's rights, or taking control of someone's time, work, etc.: encroachment on The new censorship laws are serious encroachments on freedom of expression.

encroachment noun
(SPORT)
[ U ] in some sports, an instance of a player moving too close to the ball or an opponent before the play begins: The referee called a penalty for encroachment on the defence, allowing the offence to move up five yards.
